JobTitle: Strategic Partnerships Lead, Uber Direct Restaurants
JobFullDesc: About the Role As a Strategic Partnerships Lead, you will be responsible for pursuing new restaurant partnerships for our latest Direct product by effectively communicating the value proposition of our delivery API solution. Uber Direct is a white-label offering that allows brands to offer delivery to their customers on their websites or apps through Uber’s fleet. You will be responsible for partnering with the Uber Eats sales team, building relationships with restaurant partners, and building and closing a pipeline to reach your goals. We are looking for someone with experience selling and negotiating enterprise contracts for technical products in a sales or business development capacity.  What You'll DoLead and coordinate end-to-end sales motion for Enterprise restaurant Direct prospects including qualification, education, pricing/quoting, contract negotiation to close dealsPartner closely with the Uber Eats Enterprise Sales team on each account to collaboratively position and sell Direct to restaurant brandsBuild strategic relationships to gain positioning with decision makers while driving growth of new Direct businessThink strategically about how Direct could uniquely fit into each brand’s delivery offering and within the larger Uber Eats relationshipShare merchant insights with business & product teams to drive continuous improvements in the Direct offeringHelp identify and build best practices for our sales team and Uber EatsProvide opportunity status by regularly updating SFDC, doing forecasts and participating in quarterly business reviews.Basic Qualifications5+ years of experience in end-to-end Enterprise sales and/or partnershipsExperience selling into or partnering with large, complex enterprise brands and organizationsExperience working cross-functionallyPreferred QualificationsExperience with food delivery and/or third-party marketplaces at a high-growth tech companyExperience working cross collaboratively with different business teams and partnering on deals to get them across the finish lineExperience leading conversations with executive level external partnersAbility to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyersExcellent listening, communication, and organizational skillsExcellent negotiation, forecasting, and problem solving skillsCollaborative leadership. You can’t help but dig in tactically, flexing your analytical skills where needed, and are equally as comfortable leading a conversation with an Engineer, Product Manager, or C-level executive to secure buy-inCoachability, interest in implementing feedback, and dedication to the improvement of your craft and our team's developmentSpeed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguityProficiency with SalesforceBachelor's Degree or equivalent
